items.question: If the study of fishes interests you, what field or branch of study would you choose to specialize in?
Living organisms have the ability to maintain a stable internal environment and transform from an immature to mature functional form. These attributes are _______ respectively.
Which of the following is the BEST example of the biological principle of structural adaptations?

choices.text: There are many breeds of dogs.

items.question: Which of the following levels of organization is arranged in the correct sequence starting from most to least inclusive?
What is a true ecosystem?

choices.text: Primary consumers are least dependent upon producers.
Producers are more than primary consumers.
Secondary consumers are the largest and most powerful.

items.question: Which biome is correctly paired with a factor or organism that is found there?

A wetland is an ecosystem in which water either covers the soil or is present at or near the surface of the soil for at least part of the year. Wetland areas are under government protection because they are
Autotrophs are organisms that

choices.text: rely on other organisms for their energy and food supply
consume plant and animal remains and other dead matter
use energy they take in from the environment to convert inorganic molecules into complex organic molecules

items.question: Which of the following is a food chain?
The energy pyramid shows the decreasing pattern of energy from producers to the consumers and from one trophic level to another. Producers are placed at the base of the energy pyramid because

choices.text: they are used up at a faster rate
they have the most amount of energy available
they can be found in aquatic and terrestrial ecosystem
they have pigments available in producing their own food

items.question: Human activities, such as the burning of fossil fuels, cycle carbon through the carbon cycle. Which other process(es) also participate(s) in the carbon cycle?

choices.text: nitrogen fixation by bacteria on legume roots
evaporation of water vapor into the atmosphere
movement of organic phosphates through the food web

items.question: Which is NOT true about matter in the biosphere?

choices.text: Matter is recycled in the biosphere.
Oxygen and nitrogen cycles transform and reuse molecules
The total amount of matter decreases over time.
The lack of specific nutrient can reduce productivity in an ecosystem.

items.question: When a scientist reports truthfully and acknowledge sources of information, he has
The four basic needs of living things are ____.

As amphibians bullfrogs spend their lives in or near the water of ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. As winter approaches, bullfrogs burrow into the mud of pond or stream bottom to hibernate. The physical conditions that the bullfrog requires to survive are part of its

The cowbird lays its eggs in other bird's nest. When the cowbird egg hatches, the "parents" feed the cowbird along with their own young, which the young cowbird then pushes out of the nest. This illustrates what type of symbiotic relationship?
A population is a group of individuals that belong to the same species and live in the same area. Which of the following would increase the size of population?
A science skill that requires the use of one or more of the human sense organs is termed as
How does reforestation promote sustainable development?

choices.text: Periodic clearing and developing forest will eradicate weeds and grasses for the next planting season.
Planting new trees to replace cut ones will prevent soil erosion and protect the watersheds.
Preserving virgin forests will conserve wildlife.
Clear cutting will provide timber for man's use.

items.question: The dumping of non-biodegradable materials like plastics in the environment could casue
Which of the following activities brings a harmful effect to the environment?

choices.text: waste recycling in which refuse materials are converted into useful materials
selective logging in which only mature trees with a diameter of 60 cm or more are cut and 70% of the mature trees are left into the forest
crop rotation in which one kind of crop is planted for a year and another kind of crop is grown in the next year
kaingin farming in which forest trees are burned to clear an area for planting crops

items.question: When a body of water is filled with aquatic plants and other decayed matter, this water is polluted. The presence of decayed matter on the surface of the water and the foul odor will deplete oxygen. Which of the following will likely to happen?

choices.text: The body of water will become a dumping site.
Fish and other living organisms will die.
The aquatic plants will depend more on water nutrients.
The body of water will restore its normal state.

items.question: When you go shopping, what will you do to save environment?

choices.text: Shop for products that have as little packaging as possible.
In any store, use a bag even it is not needed.
Do not reduce the frequency of shopping.

items.question: Dengue fever has caused death to many children and adults. All these can be traced to

choices.text: poor maintenance of home compost pits
poor hoarding of water in tanks

items.question: Which of the following processes is the primary reason why scientists repeat the measurement they take during experiments?

choices.text: to list the data in a tabulation
to find out if the equipment is working

items.question: The following personality traits are found to be common among scientists EXCEPT

choices.text: They are curious about causes of natural phenomena.
They have a strong passion for research.
They prefer to work in groups.
They have a strong motivation to achieve.

items.question:
Which concepts are important in Darwin's theory of evolution by natural selection? 
I. Struggle for existence
II. Survival of the fittest
III. Descent with modification
Humans, monkey, and apes are all primates because they share common traits. Humans differ from primates because
Throughout the history of life on Earth, which factor has probably been the chief cause of the extinction of species?

choices.text: human interference with the natural environment
failure to adapt to the environmental change

items.question: Which of the following is correctly ranked in increasing order of inclusiveness?
A new organism has been discovered that cannot produce its own food. Therefore, it should NOT be placed into the kingdom
The following are characteristics of living things EXCEPT
The basic requirement of organisms to stay alive
The leaves of a plant appear green because chlorophyll
In addition to light and chlorophyll, photosynthesis requires
The products of photosynthesis are
Life on earth depends largely on
Which choice best illustrates a thigmotropism?
Forests are called "lungs of the earth". Why?

choices.text: They supply earth with carbon dioxide.
They are the source of food for other organisms.
They get their energy directly to the sun.

items.question: Most of the free-living flatworms are hermaphrodites. A hermaphrodite is an organism that

choices.text: has both male and female reproductive organs

items.question: Which animals have four pairs of walking legs?
One might think that with such extreme variations in habitat, fishes would be difficult to characterize. Which of the following is NOT a fish?
Animal communication can occur through
Amphibian means "double life", emphasizing that these animals live both in water and on land. Which of the following is an amphibian?
Which characteristic is an important adaptation that separates birds from animals?

choices.text: their lack of a bony skeleton

items.question: Which is NOT a characteristic of all mammals?

choices.text: the ability to generate body heat internally

items.question: A characteristic of endotherms is that they

choices.text: obtain heat from outside their bodies
have relatively low rates of metabolism

items.question: When a male sea lion patrols the area of beach where his female sea lions rest, he is displaying
What do you call the reduction of activity by animals during summer?
Which of the following statements regarding cell theory is/are FALSE?

choices.text: Some living things are composed of cells.
Cells are the basic units of structure and function in living things.
New cells are produced from existing cells.
The cell is the smallest  part of a living thing which performs all the processes a living organism does.

items.question: Which organelle modifies proteins produced in the ribosomes that passed through the rough endoplasmic reticulum?

The dwarf water buffalo and the maple tree have eukaryotic type of cells. Which of the following organelles is present in the cells of the dwarf water buffalo but absent in the cells of the maple tree?
Which arrangement of cell-related terms correctly represents the relationships involved?

choices.text: A nucleus includes chromosomes that contain several genes.
Several nuclei make up genes that are located on chromosomes.
A gene is made up of chromosomes that are located in the cytoplasm.
Chromosomes are composed of nuclei that include several genes.

items.question: A normal human zygote contains a full set of

choices.text: 23 chromosomes, one half from each parent
46 chromosomes, one half from each parent

items.question: Normal cell division results in the production of
The life cycle undergone by insects is called
Two organs are considered to be part of the same body system if the organs

choices.text: are located next to each other
work together to carry out a life function
are made up of cells with organelles

items.question: Which is the functional layer of the skin and is made mostly of connective tissue?
What determines difference in skin color among individuals?

choices.text: number of melanocytes in the skin
amount of melanin produced by each melanocyte
amount of keratin in the skin
amount of sebum produced in the dermis

items.question: All are important roles of the skeletal system EXCEPT
The tough connective tissue layer surrounding bone is called

Complete this analogy,
      Lower arm: radius and ulna
      Leg: ___________
Most vertebrates have
What type of joint is responsible for straightening or bending our arms and legs?
Which would you advise to children to prevent osteoporosis?
More than 40% of the mass of the average human body is muscle. What muscle are you going to use to lift a book?
The main function of the human digestive system is to

choices.text: break down large, insoluble molecules into smaller, soluble molecules
synthesize minerals and vitamins needed for a healthy body

items.question: The correct sequence of structures in the gut is

choices.text: stomach, esophagus, small intestine, large intestine
esophagus, stomach, large intestine, small intestine
esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine
esophagus, small intestine, stomach, large intestine

items.question: A person who has had the gallbladder removed may be expected to have some difficulty in
What does the pancreas do during digestion?

choices.text: returns excess water to the bloodstream after digestion is completed

items.question: What does the liver do with materials absorbed into the bloodstream during digestion?
Which body system supplies nutrients and oxygen to the cells?
Most absorption of the end products of digestion into the circulatory system in humans occurs

choices.text: through the lining of the esophagus
through the villi of the small intestine

items.question: Which group consists entirely of materials found in the human blood?

Because of the differences in the surface of blood cells that acts as antigens, human blood is classified into four different blood types namely A, AB, B, and O. Blood type AB is also known as "universal recipient" because

choices.text: it has antibody against A and B
it has no antibody against A and B
it has antigen A and antibody against B
it has antigen B and antibody against A

items.question: Which cells are able to protect the body by engulfing foreign cells or producing antibodies?
Which is the pathway of blood through the body, including the lungs?

choices.text: heart → pulmonary arteries → body → vena cava → heart → aorta → lungs → pulmonary veins → heart
heart → aorta → body → vena cava → heart → pulmonary arteries → lungs → pulmonary veins → heart
heart → vena cava → body → aorta → heart → pulmonary arteries → lungs → pulmonary veins → heart
heart → aorta → body → vena cava → heart → pulmonary veins → lungs → pulmonary arteries → heart

items.question: Blood goes upward as it travels through the veins back to the heart. Why does it not flow backward?

choices.text: there are valves in the veins

items.question: To aid the process of breathing, the diaphragm

choices.text: increases blood flow from the heart to the lungs
moves up and down to alter the volume of the chest cavity
inflates and deflates to force air in and out of the lungs
moves the rib cage in and out as air is inhaled

items.question: Which is the pathway of oxygen into the lungs?

choices.text: nose → pharynx → larynx → trachea → bronchus → bronchiole → alveolus
mouth → larynx → pharynx → alveolus → bronchus → bronchiole
nose → bronchus → trachea → larynx → pharynx → alveolus
mouth → trachea → bronchiole → alveolus → pharynx → bronchus → larynx

items.question: Which is NOT a function of the kidneys

choices.text: regulation of the water content of blood

items.question: Which is the pathway of urine

choices.text: glomerulus → renal tubule → ureter → urinary bladder → urethra
kidney → ureter → urinary bladder → prostate gland → urethra
urinary bladder → ureter → urethra → prostate gland

items.question: The central nervous system consists of
Which part of the human brain is responsible for the voluntary or conscious activities of the body and the site of intelligence, learning, and judgement?
The sympathetic nervous system and the parasympathetic nervous system are the divisions of the
What nerves are found in the inner ear that send impulses to the brain?
What sense organ contains structures that help the central nervous system maintain balance or equilibrium?
What explains why our lips are redder than our palm?

choices.text: many blood vessels are located around the lips
there is increased blood flow in the lips

items.question: Which of the following causes our nose to "run" when we cry?

choices.text: tears enter the duct to the nasal cavity

items.question: Which is NOT an endocrine gland?
Endocrine glands are ductless, what does ductless mean?
A boy is starting to notice that his shoulders are getting broader and his voice is changing. What hormone is responsible for this changes?
Which is the pathway of the sperm?

choices.text: epididymis → seminiferous tubules →ampulla → vas deferens → urethra
vas deferens → urethra → seminiferous tubules → epididymis → ampulla
seminiferous tubules → epididymis → vas deferens → ampulla → urethra
urethra → ampulla → vas deferens → epididymis → seminiferous tubules

items.question: Which is the pathway of the egg?
Mycobacterium leprae causes leprosy, Corynebacterium diphtheria causes diphtheria and Vibrio comma causes
Which statement describes one effect of a fever?

choices.text: it increases the growth of pathogens
it decreases the rate of chemical reactions
it decreases the number of white blood cells

items.question: If a doctor describes a patient as dehydrated, he means that the patient

choices.text: has lost a great deal of water

items.question:
Situation (98-100):
The class was asked to design an experiment to test the effect of detergent on fish. One group came up with this experimental design: for detergent, they got Tide, Surf, and Champion. For dish, they had Tilapia Fingerling, Gold fish, and Baby Janitor Fish contained in different sizes and shapes of bodies. To the Tilapia Fingerling, they put one tbsp. of Surf, and to the Baby Janitor fish, one tbsp. of Champion.

Is there any defect in the experimental design?

choices.text: yes there is but was compensated by the use of not only one type of fish
yes there is but was remedied by the fact that 3 kinds of detergents were used
yes not only one but several
none it was a simple yet perfect design

items.question: What is the dependent variable?

How can the experimental design be improved?
I. Focus on one independent variable at a time, e.g. brand of detergent
II. Make use of the same type and size of fish
III. increase the number of fish and reduce the number of detergent
